Sentencas: The catalytic activity of single chamber solid oxide fuel cells (SC-SOFCs) with respect to hydrocarbon fuels induces a major overheating of the fuel cell, temperature variations along its length, and changes in the original fuel/air composition mainly over the anode component.
Titulo: Temperature and performance variations along single chamber solid oxide fuel cells

Sentencas: This paper assesses the temperature gradients and the variations in performance along electrolyte-supported Ni-YSZ/YSZ/LSM cells fed with methane gas.
Titulo: Temperature and performance variations along single chamber solid oxide fuel cells

Sentencas: The investigations are performed in a useful range of CH4/O-2 ratios between 1.0 and 2.0, in which the furnace temperature and flow rate of methane-air Mixtures are held constant at 700 degrees C and 450sccm, respectively.
Titulo: Temperature and performance variations along single chamber solid oxide fuel cells

Sentencas: Electrochemical impedance spectroscopy (EIS) is used to sense the temperature at the location where smaller size cathodes are positioned oil the opposite side of a full-size anode.
Titulo: Temperature and performance variations along single chamber solid oxide fuel cells

Sentencas: Due to temperature increases, cells always perform better when the small cathodes are located at the inlet as well as at a CH4/O-2 ratio of 1.0.
Titulo: Temperature and performance variations along single chamber solid oxide fuel cells

Sentencas: With an increase in ratio, the results show the presence of artefacts due to the use of ail active LSM material for the combustion of methane, and open-type gas distribution plates for the single chamber reactor.
Titulo: Temperature and performance variations along single chamber solid oxide fuel cells
